name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @IsaacDovere: NEW - Why Obama spoke out now: He’s always said he’s going to speak out when (a) American values are threatened and (b) he can have impact,” said an adviser. “This moment is both.” https://t.co/OZqDd0Air7

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: Something overlooked in the coverage of Jim Mattis's statement denouncing Trump: He specifically endorsed the anti-police violence protests: 
https://t.co/5fiRg9I9O7

name: TheAtlantic
text: The former secretary of defense broke his silence, denouncing President Donald Trump. The latest Atlantic Daily, from @mimbsy: https://t.co/2IHU4T3kLO

name: TheAtlantic
text:

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdamSerwer: From the moment he took office, Trump has encouraged police to be brutal with people in their custody—as a matter of  administration policy, presidential rhetoric and personal ideology. It’s the culmination of a worldview he has held for decades.  https://t.co/XUU7hmfgR2 https://t.co/0bR4uTyBiI

text: An epidemiologist explains how structural racism poses a threat to public health. https://t.co/K83wGW3Fhe

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JamesFallows: Very good @TheAtlantic piece by @AdamHSays on the history of “commissions,” as palliatives. 

https://t.co/J3r0UfpRAm

“We should start a commission on [XX problem]” is the  counterpart to “we need to have a ‘conversation' on…"

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "Politicians have to actually act on the recommendations—the ones that have been laid out decade after decade—and they have to do it now." Read @AdamHSays's latest:  https://t.co/gWO1D0t331

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: The darkest two months in modern American history have coincided with the greatest 50-day rally in S&P 500 history. 

I wrote about what the hell is going on.

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @julieebeck: if you read @arthurbrooks’s piece “Your Professional Decline Is Coming Sooner Than You Think” last year and it freaked you out, today in How to Build a Life he’s got a meditation to help you cope: https://t.co/VAd7zpJjN2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Restoring tourism isn’t just an economic necessity for Europe, but a cultural one, writes @YasmeenSerhan: https://t.co/nMVG9xGT6r

name: TheAtlantic
text: Today, the Hong Kong legislature approved a law banning insults to China’s national anthem. @ssataline on the bonds that residents have forged challenging Beijing's notion of patriotism: https://t.co/cVbYBTiRCQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: The nationwide protests under way have clearly exposed the crack in the foundation of American cities, writes @RonBrownstein. https://t.co/uhdpANMLbZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Thirty-one years ago today, the Chinese People’s Liberation Army violently cleared Beijing’s Tiananmen Square of protestors, ending a six-week demonstration that had called for democracy and widespread political reform. The movement in photos: https://t.co/9DXX2fa9zo

name: TheAtlantic
text: Barack Obama didn’t want to outshine Joe Biden. He never wants to be seen as speaking for all black Americans. But he couldn't stay silent any longer, @IsaacDovere writes: https://t.co/PcUL098ObX
